javadoc:
A helper class used by GFilesystem implementors to track mappings between GFile instances and the underlying container filesystem's native file objects.

Threadsafe after initial use of {@link #storeFile(String, int, boolean, long, Object) storeFile()} by the owning filesystem.

This class also provides filename 'unique-ifying' (per directory) where an auto-incrementing number will be added to a file's filename if it is not unique in the directory.

@param the filesystem specific native file object that the user of this class wants to be able to correlate with Ghidra {@link GFile} instances.

methods.javadoc:
Creates a new {@link FileSystemIndexHelper} for the specified {@link GFileSystem}.

A "root" directory GFile will be auto-created for the filesystem.

@param fs the {@link GFileSystem} that this index will be for. @param fsFSRL the {@link FSRLRoot fsrl} of the filesystem itself. (this parameter is explicitly passed here so there is no possibility of trying to call back to the fs's {@link GFileSystem#getFSRL()} on a half-constructed filesystem.)
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a new FileSystemIndexHelper for the specified GFileSystem.
 
 A "root" directory GFile will be auto-created for the filesystem.

params.name: fs
params.comment: the GFileSystem that this index will be for.

params.name: fsFSRL
params.comment:
the FSRLRoot of the filesystem itself.
 (this parameter is explicitly passed here so there is no possibility of trying to call
 back to the fs's GFileSystem#getFSRL() on a half-constructed filesystem.)

methods.javadoc:
Gets the root {@link GFile} object for this filesystem index.
@return root {@link GFile} object.
methods.name: getRootDir
methods.comment: Gets the root GFile object for this filesystem index.

methods.javadoc: Removes all file info from this index.
methods.name: clear
methods.comment: Removes all file info from this index.

methods.javadoc:
Number of files in this index.
@return number of file in this index.
methods.name: getFileCount
methods.comment: Number of files in this index.

return.comment: number of file in this index.

methods.name: getMetadata
methods.comment: Gets the opaque filesystem specific blob that was associated with the specified file.

params.name: f
params.comment: GFile to look for.

return.comment: Filesystem specific blob associated with the specified file, or null if not found.

methods.name: getListing

params.name: directory
params.comment:
GFile directory to get the list of child files that have been
 added to this index, null means root directory.

return.comment: List of GFile files that are in the specified directory, never null.

methods.name: lookup

params.name: path
params.comment: path and filename of a file to find.

return.comment: GFile instance or null if no file was added to the index at that path.

methods.name: storeFile
methods.comment:
Creates and stores a file entry into in-memory indexes.
 
 The string path will be normalized to forward slashes before being split into
 directory components.
 
 Filenames that are not unique in their directory will have a "[nnn]"
 suffix added to the resultant GFile name, where nnn is the file's
 order of occurrence in the container file.

params.name: path
params.comment:
string path and filename of the file being added to the index.  Back
 slashes are normalized to forward slashes.

params.name: fileIndex
params.comment:
the filesystem specific unique index for this file, or -1
 if not available.

params.name: isDirectory
params.comment: boolean true if the new file is a directory

params.name: length
params.comment: number of bytes in the file or -1 if not known or directory.

params.name: fileInfo
params.comment:
opaque blob that will be stored and associated with the new
 GFile instance.

methods.name: storeFileWithParent
methods.comment:
Creates and stores a file entry into in-memory indexes.
 
 Use this when you already know the parent directory GFile object.
 
 Filenames that are not unique in their directory will have a "[nnn]"
 suffix added to the resultant GFile name, where nnn is the file's
 order of occurrence in the container file.

params.name: filename
params.comment: the new file's name

params.name: parent
params.comment: the new file's parent directory

params.name: fileIndex
params.comment:
the filesystem specific unique index for this file, or -1
 if not available.

params.name: isDirectory
params.comment: boolean true if the new file is a directory

params.name: length
params.comment: number of bytes in the file or -1 if not known or directory.

params.name: fileInfo
params.comment:
opaque blob that will be stored and associated with the new
 GFile instance.

methods.name: getDirectoryContents
methods.comment: Returns a string-GFile map that holds the contents of a single directory.

methods.javadoc:
Walks a list of names of directories in nameparts (stopping prior to the last element) starting at the root of the filesystem and returns the final directory.

Directories in a path that have not been encountered before (ie. a file's path references a directory that hasn't been mentioned yet as its own file entry) will have a stub entry GFile created for them.

Superfluous slashes in the original filename (ie. name/sub//subafter_extra_slash) will be represented as empty string elements in the nameparts array and will be skipped as if they were not there.

@param nameparts @return
methods.name: lookupParent
methods.comment:
Walks a list of names of directories in nameparts (stopping prior to the last element)
 starting at the root of the filesystem and returns the final directory.
 
 Directories in a path that have not been encountered before (ie. a file's path references a directory
 that hasn't been mentioned yet as its own file entry) will have a stub entry GFile created for them.
 
 Superfluous slashes in the original filename (ie. name/sub//subafter_extra_slash) will
 be represented as empty string elements in the nameparts array and will be skipped
 as if they were not there.

methods.name: createNewFile
methods.comment: Creates a new GFile instance, using per-filesystem custom logic.

params.name: parentFile
params.comment: the parent file of the new instance.  Never null.

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the file

params.name: isDirectory
params.comment: is this is file or directory?

params.name: size
params.comment: length of the file data

params.name: metadata
params.comment:
filesystem specific BLOB that may have data that this method needs to
 create the new GFile instance.  Can be null if this method is being called to create
 a missing directory that was referenced in a filename.

name: FileSystemIndexHelper
comment:
A helper class used by GFilesystem implementors to track mappings between GFile
 instances and the underlying container filesystem's native file objects.
 
 Threadsafe after initial use of #storeFile(String, int, boolean, long, Object)
 by the owning filesystem.
 
 This class also provides filename 'unique-ifying' (per directory) where an auto-incrementing
 number will be added to a file's filename if it is not unique in the directory.
